intro: Hieracium nigritum, commonly known as the black hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its dark green leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in clusters. Hieracium nigritum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and is often found in disturbed habitats.
